shorts.title: Lackawanna County Dem. Committee withdraws lawsuit
shorts.description: LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU)— Brenda Sacco and the Lackawanna County Democratic Committee have withdrawn their lawsuit challenging the validity of this week's special election. The chairman of the committee says that, given their registration advantage, holding special elections under their home rule charter is what is best for the democratic committee in Lackawanna County. Democrat Thom Welby [...]
shorts.content: LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU)— Brenda Sacco and the Lackawanna County Democratic Committee have withdrawn their lawsuit challenging the validity of this week's special election. The chairman of the committee says that, given their registration advantage, holding special elections under their home rule charter is what is best for the democratic committee in Lackawanna County. Democrat Thom Welby [...]
shorts.content_distilled: LACKAWANNA COUNTY — Brenda Sacco and the Lackawanna County Democratic Committee have withdrawn their lawsuit challenging the validity of this week's special election.

shorts.description: JENKINS TOWNSHIP, LUZERNE COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU)— We begin this evening with the state's chief executive visiting NEPA's largest food bank. Governor Josh Shapiro joined volunteers near Pittston to highlight food insecurity in the commonwealth. 28/22 News reporter Joe Mason has details on the governor's visit. shorts.title: Scranton's downtown traffic makeover
shorts.description: SCRANTON, LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU)— The Electric City is getting a makeover. For the first time since the 1960s, downtown Scranton will have new traffic patterns and sidewalks. 28/22 News reporter Connor Coar has more from Scranton. The project was approved by the city council with a 3-2 majority vote. The project converts one-way streets into [...]

shorts.description: SCRANTON, LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — Police are searching for a man who is reported missing in Scranton.
